comment.body:
i am using https://blockchain.info based wallet and also https://kraken.com wallet. Kraken is good to buy coins using bank transfer.
Though i do not like Bitcoin high transaction fees, 20+ minutes for transaction to "complete" and also high ecologic footprint (electricity consumption to confirm transaction - http://blog.zorinaq.com/bitcoin-mining-is-not-wasteful/, "in 2 years. On this basis the per-transaction cost would not be $0.45 but $0.68."). Yet there are alternatives for Bitcoin and many merchants support also altcoins: https://coinmarketcap.com/

I think that there should be some step by step tutorial for noob users which will guide them on all various things they can do on zeronet, there should be links to most popular sites so people not getting stuck not knowing how to usefully spend time on zeronet and what to do.
Also i would welcome tooltips on many basic functions/buttons, that may not be clear for newcomers.
I think ZeroHello interface is too basic and not meant for intensive usage. The interface should be more minimalistic to show more sites. Should allow better/instant filtering, categorizing, searching, sorting, custom naming groups of sites. Other member put it this way: "The Zeronet front page would be so much easier to navigate if we could create custom collapsible categories for our added sites to sort them up instead of one large list."
Also there should be some link on ZeroHello where newcomers can see the list of the content management systems they can use to setup their own site and setup should be very convenient for noobs.
ZeroNet should allow much more creativity to its users in regards to creating sites, sharing content with other users.
HERE IS HOW TO EDIT: on this page, in the top right corner are icons to view own channels, topics, comments. Click one and you should see the list of your posts and on the right is edit icon.

This image is also shown in the article http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/travel_news/article-4148684/Stunning-photos-reveal-life-Iran-revolution.html with a description: "Promise of a vibrant future: Female students at Tehran university in 1971 read their books in the sunshine while wearing bold miniskirts and contemporary fashions" (Picture source: R. Tarverdi (Editor) & A. Massoudi (Art editor), The land of Kings, Tehran: Rahnama Publications, 1971)

http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/merged-CDN/*/data/users/*/*.mp4
But not sure how to embed it in either zite's html code or here, some tooltip with explanation on IFS would be helpful.
Thank You. Glad to know there will be improvements/new features..

comment.body:
This zerotalk post made by a Chinese user answers the questions how Chinese users connecting ZeroNet.

Also this topic (I would like to hear more about efforts to get around national internet blockades.) is a bit relevant to the subject.

Is zeronet reliable? If user is in "Tor: always" mode (On ZeroHello page, click TOR button to enable ZN for all connections), i assume the connection between the peers is well encrypted and anonymized. If there are connection problems, some people use proxy for connections and tor bridges. See: /Config
comment.body_p: This zerotalk post made by a Chinese user answers the questions how Chinese users connecting ZeroNet.Also this topic (I would like to hear more about efforts to get around national internet blockades.) is a bit relevant to the subject.

comment.body:
i think that reason for low user count of the ZN are:

  • not easy to install (there is installer though: https://github.com/krixano/ZeroNet-Windows-Exe-Installer/releases ; or downloadable from ZeroUp zite)
  • zerohello not so user friendly (people may not know how to create their site and how to promote it easily
  • CMSs like Zerotalk are too basic when comparing to clearnet CMSs like vbulletin, xenforo etc.
  • zeronet has performance issues when you handle too many sites, optional files
  • zerohello newsfeed subscribtion system (following posts/topics replies) is not easy to use as it should be
comment.body_p: i think that reason for low user count of the ZN are:not easy to install (there is installer though: https://github.com/krixano/ZeroNet-Windows-Exe-Installer/releases ; or downloadable from ZeroUp zite)zerohello not so user friendly (people may not know how to create their site and how to promote it easilyCMSs like Zerotalk are too basic when comparing to clearnet CMSs like vbulletin, xenforo etc.zeronet has performance issues when you handle too many sites, optional fileszerohello newsfeed subscribtion system (following posts/topics replies) is not easy to use as it should be

topic.title: Water crisis in Gaza
topic.body:
I red this article (from 2017) and it says:

‚Äã‚ÄúGaza‚Äôs aquifer is overpumped by about 150 million cubic meters¬†[122,000
¬†acre feet] a year, Banna said. Around 220 million cubic meters are
drawn each year, but the annual replenishment from rainwater is only 70
million cubic meters, he said.

According to Banna, the best solution to the water crisis is to on
the one hand solve the electricity crisis and on the other to set up
more projects to desalinate seawater for human use such as the European Union-funded seawater desalination plant inaugurated in January in the southern Gaza Strip. The plant provides¬†water to 75,000 people.


However, he said¬†most seawater desalination projects are¬†frozen in light of the political situation in the besieged Gaza Strip and the political division between the Gaza Strip and the West Bank since 2007.

Unicef

says (about Gaza):


‚ÄãNinety five percent of the water extracted from the coastal aquifer is

now considered unfit for human consumption. There is over-extraction of
water from the aquifer, allowing seawater from the Mediterranean to seep
¬†into it, along with sewage and chemicals. To drink, most families
depend on water they buy from private vendors at a high cost and without
¬†quality control, or on imported water. A 2012 United Nations study
warned that the aquifer of the Gaza Strip could become unusable by 2017,
¬†with the damage irreversible by 2020.

What are news regarding this water crisis in Gaza?
topic.body_p: I red this article (from 2017) and it says:‚Äã‚ÄúGaza‚Äôs aquifer is overpumped by about 150 million cubic meters¬†[122,000¬†acre feet] a year, Banna said. Around 220 million cubic meters are drawn each year, but the annual replenishment from rainwater is only 70 million cubic meters, he said.According to Banna, the best solution to the water crisis is to on the one hand solve the electricity crisis and on the other to set up more projects to desalinate seawater for human use such as the European Union-funded seawater desalination plant inaugurated in January in the southern Gaza Strip. The plant provides¬†water to 75,000 people.However, he said¬†most seawater desalination projects are¬†frozen in light of the political situation in the besieged Gaza Strip and the political division between the Gaza Strip and the West Bank since 2007.Unicef says (about Gaza):‚ÄãNinety five percent of the water extracted from the coastal aquifer is now considered unfit for human consumption. There is over-extraction of water from the aquifer, allowing seawater from the Mediterranean to seep¬†into it, along with sewage and chemicals. To drink, most families depend on water they buy from private vendors at a high cost and without¬†quality control, or on imported water. A 2012 United Nations study warned that the aquifer of the Gaza Strip could become unusable by 2017,¬†with the damage irreversible by 2020. What are news regarding this water crisis in Gaza?

topic.title: How my money can help fight climate change?
topic.body:
How i can spend money to reduce my ecologic footprint i am making by purchasing certain stuff like computer some food that is processed/transported the way it is causing alot of CO2 emissions etc.

I am not asking how i should be shopping, but how to spend money so i null my already made footprint.

https://www.ipcc.ch

topic.title: Bitcoin price will be lower because of other crypto?
topic.body:
Hi,

i always though Bitcoin price will slowly rise, but it was at times BTC was almost only cryptocurrency.
Now there is alot of promissing cryptos and i have impression that it lowered Bitcoin price, because people use other crypto and less people use Bitcoin.

Can this rise of altcoins make the Bitcoin price by half what it was for the years where there was no competing cryptos?
topic.body_p: Hi,i always though Bitcoin price will slowly rise, but it was at times BTC was almost only cryptocurrency.Now there is alot of promissing cryptos and i have impression that it lowered Bitcoin price, because people use other crypto and less people use Bitcoin.Can this rise of altcoins make the Bitcoin price by half what it was for the years where there was no competing cryptos?

topic.title: How to prove the IPCC is objective on climate change?
topic.body: Hello, i think i read that some people says IPCC (https://www.ipcc.ch/) is not independent/objective on the things they are publishing about global warming? Is there any undeniable proof of this being true or false?
topic.body_p: Hello, i think i read that some people says IPCC (https://www.ipcc.ch/) is not independent/objective on the things they are publishing about global warming? Is there any undeniable proof of this being true or false?

topic.title: Feature: Search function on ZeroVoat
topic.body:
Hello,

i am browsing this site and when i need to ask some question not related to currently browsed channel, i have to spend time browsing all channels to find right one. This is not time efficient and will get worse as the list grow.

Better can be if the major/most important function of each ZeroVoat page is a search field for quick search. Example of such a field is at ImportantZites: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E/

You can see it instantly returns relevant data. On ZeroVoat, it can return channels which name or description match query and then below would be questions/topics that math query in its topic title and below topics that contians query only in its description or comments, not in title.

The overall design of the search results should be much more minimalistic than on ImportantZites so one do not need to excessive scroll and quickly find.

Search may support exclude operator: -excludedphrase
topic.body_p: Hello,i am browsing this site and when i need to ask some question not related to currently browsed channel, i have to spend time browsing all channels to find right one. This is not time efficient and will get worse as the list grow.Better can be if the major/most important function of each ZeroVoat page is a search field for quick search. Example of such a field is at ImportantZites: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E/You can see it instantly returns relevant data. On ZeroVoat, it can return channels which name or description match query and then below would be questions/topics that math query in its topic title and below topics that contians query only in its description or comments, not in title.The overall design of the search results should be much more minimalistic than on ImportantZites so one do not need to excessive scroll and quickly find.Search may support exclude operator: -excludedphrase

topic.title: Site:1J1c7e..FMvb - OperationalError: table user has no column named about
topic.body:
I have found this Zeronet debug.log line today:

Site:1J1c7e..FMvb Json merged-CDN/19gtNiKNZMq6nTdWThGCQQAS2bCYAY1tFh/data/users/18yg7K6AsrgChMnnsA1JTthZV6FStzWaY4/data.json load error: OperationalError: table user has no column named about in SiteStorage.py line 296 > ContentFilterPlugin.py line 165 > SiteStorage.py line 90 > Db.py line 374 > DbCursor.py line 70

Any idea what is wrong and how to fix it?

topic.title: Trees
topic.body:
Beautiful trees wallpapers

Presence of healthy trees can clean the air, increase property values, and reduce the temperature. They remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and store large quantities of carbon in their tissues. Trees and forests provide a habitat for many species of animals and plants.
topic.body_p: Beautiful trees wallpapersPresence of healthy trees can clean the air, increase property values, and reduce the temperature. They remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and store large quantities of carbon in their tissues. Trees and forests provide a habitat for many species of animals and plants.

channel.name: Ecology
channel.description: Ecology is the scientific study of the relations that living organisms have with respect to each other and their natural environment.
